required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Eggs as Part of a Healthy Breakfast
clinical_study.official_title: Eggs as Part of a Healthy Breakfast: Lack of Association With Heart Disease Risk

brief_summary.textblock: Contrary to popular belief, previous studies have demonstrated beneficial effects of whole egg consumption in modifying biomarkers indicative of a greater risk of coronary heart disease (CHD), chronic inflammation, and insulin resistance. The following study is designed to conduct a comprehensive evaluation of consuming an egg-based breakfast compared to an oatmeal-based breakfast on lipid biomarkers, oxidative stress, inflammation, insulin sensitivity, and satiety in young, healthy men and women. The investigators hypothesize that the consumption of 2 eggs per day will not negatively impact plasma lipids in a young, healthy population.

primary_outcome.measure: Spectrophotometry, NMR and ELISA will assess plasma lipids.

secondary_outcome.measure: Visual analog scales (VAS) and ELISA assays will assess satiety.

arm_group.description: Participants will consume 2 eggs per day for breakfast for 4 weeks of the study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Oatmeal - 1 packet per day for breakfast
arm_group.description: Participants will consume 1 packet of oatmeal per day for breakfast for 4 weeks of the study.

intervention.description: 11-week crossover study in which participants consumed 2 eggs or 1 packet of oatmeal per day daily for 4 weeks, separated by a 3-week washout period.
intervention.arm_group_label: Oatmeal - 1 packet per day for breakfast

intervention.description: 11-week crossover study in which participants consumed 2 eggs or 1 packet of oatmeal per day daily for 4 weeks, separated by a 3-week washout period.
intervention.arm_group_label: Oatmeal - 1 packet per day for breakfast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 18.5-30, willing to consume eggs and oatmeal daily, proficient in English, and with a healthy lipid profile.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Currently have liver disease, renal disease, diabetes, cancer, history of stroke or heart disease
- Currently taking glucose lowering drugs or supplements
- Plasma triglycerides >500 mg/dL, glucose >126, total cholesterol >240
- Pregnant, lactating, or have endocrine or metabolic disorders
- BMI â‰¥ 30
- Blood pressure > 140/90 (average of 3 readings)
- Allergies to eggs
- Celiac disease or gluten sensitivity
